messages.subject: Re:  2248 - Christianity's message
messages.msgSnippet: on 8/15/02 10:39 AM, Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com at ... Tina,  Thanks for the kind words to me. I ve always thought that the message of Jesus is not
messages.messageBody:
on 8/15/02 10:39 AM, Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com at
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com wrote:

> But I know that I love Jesus and that my kids do too. Isn't that
> what is the most important message in Christianity?
>
> Tina

Tina, Thanks for the kind words to me.

I've always thought that the message of Jesus is not merely to love him, the
person, but to live in a way that expresses his ideas. He seems to have
wanted his followers to go out and DO stuff, like heal people of their
wounds and problems, not just talk the talk.

I'm sure you're walkin' the walk, too. That's what's important, the way I
hear it.

Ned Vare
